title: 109_hr5751
content: The Act titled "Reservist's Employer Support Paycheck Enhancement Act of 2006" provides an employer credit for compensation paid to employees serving on active duty as members of the Ready Reserve or the National Guard. This credit also applies to compensation paid to temporary replacement employees. The Reservist's Employer Support Paycheck Enhancement Act of 2006 offers an employer credit for compensation paid to Ready Reserve-National Guard employees on qualified active duty, including temporary replacement employees. The credit is 50% of the compensation paid to these employees, with a limitation on the amount for Ready Reserve-National Guard employees based on their active duty wage differential. The active duty wage differential of a Ready Reserve-National Guard employee is calculated based on their daily wage differential multiplied by the number of days on qualified active duty during a period. The active duty wage differential for a Ready Reserve-National Guard employee is determined by comparing their average daily employer-provided compensation to their average daily military pay during the period of qualified active duty. The average daily employer-provided compensation is calculated based on the average compensation paid by the employer to the employee for the year before the start of active duty, adjusted for cost-of-living and other increases. The term 'compensation' refers to remuneration for employment, whether in cash or in kind, deductible under section 162(a)(1). For Ready Reserve-National Guard employees, average daily military pay is the pay and allowances received during qualified active duty. The term 'compensation' refers to remuneration for employment, whether in cash or in kind, deductible under section 162(a)(1). Military pay is defined as pay under title 37, United States Code, and allowances are the allowances payable to members of the Armed Forces under chapter 7 of such title. A limitation applies to qualified replacement employees regarding the amount of compensation considered under subsection (a). The term 'compensation' refers to remuneration for employment, whether in cash or in kind, deductible under section 162(a)(1). Military pay is defined as pay under title 37, United States Code, and allowances are the allowances payable to members of the Armed Forces under chapter 7 of such title. A limitation applies to qualified replacement employees regarding the amount of compensation considered under subsection (a). The account under subsection (a) for any qualified replacement employee shall not exceed the product of the average daily employer-provided compensation for the Ready Reserve-National Guard employee being replaced and the number of days the employee is on qualified active duty. The term 'Ready Reserve-National Guard employee' refers to any employee who is a member of the Ready Reserve or the National Guard. The term 'qualified active duty' refers to active duty for a period exceeding 90 days or for an indefinite period, excluding training duty. The National Guard is defined as per section 101(c)(1) of title 10, United States Code, and the Ready Reserve is defined as per section 10142 of title 10, United States Code. The term 'qualified active duty' excludes training duty and refers to active duty exceeding 90 days or for an indefinite period. A 'qualified replacement employee' is defined as any employee hired in connection with such active duty. The term 'qualified active duty' excludes training duty and refers to active duty exceeding 90 days or for an indefinite period. A 'qualified replacement employee' means any employee hired by the taxpayer to replace a Ready Reserve-National Guard employee during a period of qualified active duty. Amendments are made to sections 280C and 38 of the Code to include the employer Ready Reserve-National Guard employee credit. Amendment made to the table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Code. The amendments made by this section provide an employer credit for compensation paid to employees serving on active duty in the Ready Reserve or National Guard, as well as for compensation paid to temporary replacement employees. The Secretary concerned will provide necessary information to determine the credit amount. Effective for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2005.
